result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Travon King Smith-Hinton.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. State advises OTP was not done for today's hearing. Defense request next hearing to be via zoom at defendant's request. Court grants. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Travon King Smith-Hinton not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing. Defense request additional time for resolution. Court grants. Court vacates final pretrial and jury trial. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Travon King Smith-Hinton in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Travon King Smith-Hinton in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defense requests additional time for resolution. Court advises wishes to also set trial dates. State advises intends to motion for joinder and other acts if case proceeds to trial. Court orders that if plea does not proceed that on 8-19-2022 joinder and other acts motions to be filed. Defense request plea hearing via zoom. Court grants zoom appearance. State advises after next plea hearing date all offers will be revoked. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Travon King Smith-Hinton not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned in Branch 04.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Travon King Smith-Hinton not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Court is advised that defendant has been revoked.
Defense counsel is requesting adjournment to allow her to gather details regarding the revocation.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 4.

Status conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court (appears in person), defendant Travon King Smith-Hinton not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin (appears via Zoom video).
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Discussion with the parties.
Case is adjourned for status in Branch 4.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Travon King Smith-Hinton in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Travon King Smith-Hinton in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  

This hearing will be streamed live on YouTube: 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1U3FddFaQmDrwcXp6sBGNg  

Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with 
Jodie L B (Victim)
Kamauri G, 
Deonta R, 
and Tyveria C
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving.

Defendant Travon King Smith-Hinton in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Travon King Smith-Hinton in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Travon King Smith-Hinton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 4. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:
